channel.title: Stop source stealing V2! [THIS WAY IS MORE EFFECTIVE]
channel.description:
Secure your website by coding it using my coding tool: http://www.thecampcompany.nl/securenow.html [u]No-one will be able to decode this!!! Because you can code ur coded website again and again! And the only thing left is a whole bunch of text.[/u] Note: Make a copy of your original source first, or you wont be able to edit your website, lol! Comments/Critic is welcome :D
Grtz,
born-in-darkness@hotmail.com
EDIT: I just found out this owns Ron's script, (http://goons.freepgs.com/TEST3/show_source.php) Test it yourself, I secured the www.google.com page and tried to get the source. http://www.thecampcompany.nl/googletest.html is my secured google, when I tried to get the source using Ron's script it said: <script> <!-- document.write(unescape("%3Chtml%3E%3Chead%3E%3Cmeta%20http-equiv%3D%22content-type%22%20content%3D%22text/html%3B%20charset%3DUTF-8%22%3E%3Ctitle%3EGoogle%3C/title%3E%3Cstyle%3E%3C%21--%0D%0Abody%2Ctd%2Ca%2Cp%2C.h%7Bfont-family%3Aarial%2Csans-serif%7D%0D%0A.h%7Bfont-size%3A20px%7D%0D%0A.q%7Bcolor%3A%2300c%7D%0D%0A--%3E%3C/style%3E%0D%0A%3Cscript%3E%0D%0A%3C%21--%0D%0Afunction%20sf%28%29%7Bdocument.f.q.focus%28%29%3B%7D%0D%0Afunction%20clk%28url%2Coi%2Ccad%2Cct%2Ccd%2Csg%29%7Bif%28document.images%29%7Bvar%20e%20%3D%20window.encodeURIComponent%20%3F%20encodeURIComponent%20%3A%20escape%3Bvar%20u%3D%22%22%3Bvar%20oi_param%3D%22%22%3Bvar%20cad_param%3D%22%22%3Bif%20%28url%29%20u%3D%22%26url%3D%22+e%28url.replace%28/%23.*/%2C%22%22%29%29.replace%28/%5C+/g%2C%22%252B%22%29%3Bif%20%28oi%29%20oi_param%3D%22%26oi%3D%22+e%28oi%29%3Bif%20%28cad%29%20cad_param%3D%22%26cad%3D%22+e%28cad%29%3Bnew%20Image%28%29.src%3D%22/url%3Fsa%3DT%22+oi_param+cad_param+%22%26ct%3D%22+e%28ct%29+%22%26cd%3D%22+e%28cd%29+u+%22%26ei%3Dg3YzRfbbIY6QRcimsbQO%22+sg%3B%7Dreturn%20true%3B%7D%0D%0A//%20--%3E%0D%0A%3C/script%3E%0D%0A%3C/head%3E%3Cbody%20bgcolor%3D%23ffffff%20text%3D%23000000%20link%3D%230000cc%20vlink%3D%23551a8b%20alink%3D%23ff0000 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
LoL OWNED! I am teh win! xD

item.title: Stop source stealing V2! [THIS WAY IS MORE EFFECTIVE]
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Heh, I knew a fair bit of javascript when I did web development, but I haven’t done anything serious with web programming for about 3 years now :\ There’s probably a better way to even count that number of unescapes, but meh, I dunno.

Btw, that code’s logic is “wrong”…the unescape count should be srcString.split(“unescape”).length - 1, and I should have a <= in the for loop…but it works the same

Read full topic
item.source: Stop source stealing V2! [THIS WAY IS MORE EFFECTIVE]

item.title: Stop source stealing V2! [THIS WAY IS MORE EFFECTIVE]
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:7, topic:18563”]Actually your wrong Bang Train The method he posted is actually a bit more complicated than that

Your code worked because the google page was encrypted only once…it won’t work first time 1337h4x’s…but theres still a stupid simply fix.

function decodeStupidEscapeFunctionEncoding(srcString) {
    var unescapeCount = srcString.split("unescape").length;
    for(var i = 0; i < unescapeCount; i++)
        srcString = unescape(srcString);
    
    var startOfSource = srcString.lastIndexOf("unescape(\"") + 10,
        endOfSource = srcString.indexOf("\"));")
    srcString = srcString.substring(startOfSource, endOfSource);
    
    return srcString;
}

I even added some nice formatting Without it, you’d get a bunch of lines.[/quote]

aww u made it count the number of unescape’s and do it that many times…nice

i dont know much of js anymore (only learned it so i could make a firefox extension) and plus i had an AQ20 raid on WoW in 10 mins

Read full topic

item.title: Stop source stealing V2! [THIS WAY IS MORE EFFECTIVE]
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Actually your wrong Bang Train The method he posted is actually a bit more complicated than that

Your code worked because the google page was encrypted only once…it won’t work first time 1337h4x’s…but theres still a stupid simply fix.

function decodeStupidEscapeFunctionEncoding(srcString) {
    var unescapeCount = srcString.split("unescape").length;
    for(var i = 0; i < unescapeCount; i++)
        srcString = unescape(srcString);
    
    var startOfSource = srcString.lastIndexOf("unescape(\"") + 10,
        endOfSource = srcString.indexOf("\"));")
    srcString = srcString.substring(startOfSource, endOfSource);
    
    return srcString;
}

I even added some nice formatting Without it, you’d get a bunch of lines.

Read full topic

item.title: Stop source stealing V2! [THIS WAY IS MORE EFFECTIVE]
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I would recommend you read this thread now. http://www.moparisthebest.org/smf/index.php/topic,18441.0.html

Protecting source code is impossible. I repeat…impossible. You can make it more and more difficult, but in the end the browser has to be able to decypher the code and therefore you can as well. Simple.

Sure, you can encrypt this again and again, but you can use a script to iterate the “decryption” (which is the dumb unescape function) to obtain the source.

Read full topic
